title.rendered: Statement on Opponents’ Embrace of Floridian Pushing for a Tax Increase on 40 Percent of Georgians

content.rendered:
ATLANTA – Today, Stacey Abrams issued the following statement responding to her opponents’ embrace of last evening’s “Special Guest” at the Georgia Republican Party Spring Gala:

“During my time in the legislature, I used my expertise in tax policy to stop multiple Republican-sponsored tax increases. Last evening, the Georgia Republican Party is celebrating U.S. Senator Rick Scott of Florida – their leading advocate for a massive federal tax increase on Georgia families. Brian Kemp, David Perdue and other Republicans spend federal investments made possible by Democrats, and they remain silent about Scott’s plan to hike taxes for 40 percent of Georgians. This hypocrisy is no surprise. For years, my opponents have proven themselves to be “tax and pretend” Republicans: redistributing Georgians’ federal tax dollars to 38 other states, creating jobs and saving hospitals outside of Georgia because they refuse to support the expansion of Medicaid access to more than 500,000 of our people. As governor, I will expand Medicaid, keep Georgians’ tax dollars in our state and oppose anyone who tries to take money out of the pockets of hardworking Georgians.”

The Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy revealed that Georgia will be among the states hardest hit by Scott’s proposal; taxes would be raised on more than 40 percent of Georgians.    

In 2011, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution ran a headline reading, “How Stacey Abrams helped defeat GOP tax bill” about the unlikely bipartisan coalition Stacey assembled to defeat a proposal that would have required a $70 million cumulative tax increase on Georgia families.

TIME reported in 2018, “on the campaign trail Abrams can credibly boast of having single-handedly stopped the largest tax increase in Georgia history.”

###
